hint_content.html:
Let's do this one step a time. Write some blanks for the digits of the number:

           __ __ __ __ __ 

Now, let's work through the sum row by row. Since "ten thousand" = 10000, this means that "6 ten thousands" = 60000. Notice that the 6 is in the 5th place from the right, so we can write that here as well:

          6 __ __ __ __ 

See if you can continue doing this for the other parts of the question!

Let's do another two steps. We currently have:

          6 __ __ __ __ 

Because there is no value for the thousands and hundreds place, its digit is 0. So we can write a 0 in the 4th and 3rd place from the right:

          6 0 0 __ __ 

Now, let's add 3 tens. Since "tens" = 10, this means that "3 tens" = 30. So, 3 is in the 2th place from the right. We can write that here as well:

          6 0 0 3 __ 

See if you can continue doing this for the other parts of the question!

content.html:
Jaime is still at the arcade with Nic. He knows that his score has multiple places, but he’s still not sure what the value of his score is. Let’s help Jaime figure out how much his score is worth!

You should know the following before going on:

  • The names of all the places in a number (up to the "ten thousands" place)

  • How to identify the place of a digit in a number

Before you begin, please get some paper and a pen or pencil to write with, and find a quiet place to work. Take your time, and go through the story at your own pace. Understanding is more important than speed.

Once you’re ready, click Continue to get started!

hi.html:
Jay abhi bhi Nikki ke saath hai. Wo jaanta hai ki uske score mein kayi sthaan hain, lekin use abhi bhi uske score ka moolya pata nahi hai. Ab hum Jay ko yeh pata lagaane mein madad karenge ki uska score kitna hai!

Aage badhne se pehle aapko pata hona chahiye:

  • ek sankhya mein sabhee sthaanon ke naam (das hajaaron yani "ten thousands" sthaan tak)
  • ek sankhya mein ankon ke staan kaise pehchaan karen

Shuroo karane se pahale, kripya likhne ke liye kuchh kaagaj aur ek kalam ya pencil lo, aur kaam karne ke liye ek shaant jagah dhoondho. Apana samay le lo, aur bina kisi jaldi ke, aaram se kahaani padho. Taiyaar hone ke baad, "Continue" button par dabao!

hint_content.html: The digit all the way to the right (7) is in the ones place. Start labelling the names of the places from there.

Starting from 7 (which is in the ones place), count up each place to the left, one by one.

So, the digit 6 to the left of the ones place is in the tens place.

Keep going until you get to the hundreds place.

content.html:
"Congratulations!" said Nic. "Now, you know the values of the places!"

"Yes!" said Jaime. "I get it now. So, the 1 in 1489 represents one thousand. But, what if some digits in my score are greater than 1?"

"haan!" Jay ne kaha. "Mai samajh gaya. Isliye, 1489 mein ank 1 ki moolya hajaar hai. Lekin,  agar mere score mein kuchh ank 1 se adhik hain, toh?"

default_outcome.dest: The value of all the places

content.html:
“Okay Nic, I understand that my score has lots of digits in it and that each digit represents a place. But, I still don’t know how much my score is worth,” Jaime said.

“You see, Jaime, each place has a value," Nic explained. "Think of just the ones place. A 1 in the ones place is worth just 1. If your score in a game is 1, you only scored one point. But, what if there’s a 1 in the tens place instead? Then, your score is 10, and you have 10 points -- not just 1.”

“Cool! So, is each place worth a different amount?” Jaime asked.

“Yes, exactly!" said Nic. "The hundreds place is worth even more than the tens and the ones. A 1 in the hundreds place makes 100. That’s more than a 1 in the tens place, which is worth 10. And, it’s more than a 1 in the ones place, which is worth 1."

"And," Nic continued, "the farther left you go, the higher the value gets. For example, let’s go left one place from the hundreds place. That’s the thousands place. A 1 in the thousands place makes 1000, which is worth more than 100, 10, or 1!”

hi.html:
Jay ne kaha, “Theek hai Nikki, main samaajhta hoon ki mere score mein bahut saare ank hain aur har ank ek sthaan par rehta hai. Lekin mujhe abhi bhi pata nahin hai ki mera score kitna hai."

"Dekho, Jay, har sthaan ka ek moolya hai," Nikki ne samajhaaya. "Bas ek yani ones staan  ke baare mein socho. Ek yani ones sthaan par ank 1 ka moolya sirph 1 hai. Yadi kisi khel mein agar aapka score 1 hai, to aapne keval ek point banaaya hai. Lekin, agar iske bajaay dasiyon yani tens staan par 1 hai to kya hoga? Phir, aapaka skor 10 hai, aur aapake 10 points hain - sirph 1 nahin.

"Toh, har sthaan ke ek alag moolya hai? " Jay ne poochha.

"Haan, bilkul!" Nikki ne kaha. "Saikadon yani hundreds staan dasiyon aur ek waale sthaan se bhi adhik mooly ki hai. Agar saikadon staan pe 1 hai toh 100 points bante hai. Ye dasiyon sthaan par 1 se adhik hai, jisaka moolya 10 hai aur yeh ek sthaan par 1 se adhik hai, jiska moolya 1 hai."

"Aur," Nikki ne bola, "Jitna door aap baen jaate ho, utna hee adhik moolya hoga. udaaharan ke lie, chalo saikadon jagah se ek sthaan baen ko dekhte hai. yah hajaaron yani thousands staan hai. Agar hajaaron staan pe 1 hai toh 1000 ka moolya banta hai.. 100 ,10, aur 1 se bhi adhik! "

feedback.html: Correct!

feedback.html: Correct!

No, that's not correct. If the number was 1234, then the 4 would have value 4. That's because 4 is in the "ones" place, and each "one" has a value of 1 (with no zeros at the end). So, "4 ones" = 4.

But, in Jaime's score, 4 is in the "hundreds" place. So, what value does it represent? Try again.

No, that's not correct. If the number was 3142, then the 4 would have value 40. That's because 4 is in the "tens" place, and each "ten" has a value of 10. So, "4 tens" = 40.

But, in Jaime's score, 4 is in the "hundreds" place. So, what value does it represent? Try again.

No, that's not correct. If the number was 4321, then the 4 would have value 4000. That's because 4 is in the "thousands" place, and each "thousand" has a value of 1000 (with three zeros at the end). So, "4 thousands" = 4000.

But, in Jaime's score, 4 is in the "hundreds" place. So, what value does it represent? Try again.
No, that's not correct. What is the value of the hundreds place? Use that to figure out the actual value of the 4 in 1489.

hint_content.html: The digit 4 is in the hundreds place. Do you remember what the value of the hundreds place is?

Let's take a look at the digits in Jaime's score, 1489. We'll start from the right.

  • The 9 represents "9 ones". Each "one" has value 1. So, "9 ones" = 9.
  • The 8 represents "8 tens". Each "ten" has value 10. So, "8 tens" = 80.
  • The 1 represents "1 thousand". Each "thousand" has value 1000. So, "1 thousand" = 1000.

What about the 4, which represents "4 hundreds"? Can you follow the logic above, and figure it out?
The 4 represents "4 hundreds". If each "hundred" has value 100, what is the value of "4 hundreds"?

content.html:
"Well," said Nic, "the digit in a place tells you what the value for that place is. For example, the digit in the hundreds place tells you how many hundreds there are. If the digit in the hundreds place is 1, it is worth 100. If that digit is 3, it is worth 300."

"Now, you try it!" said Nic. "Let’s look at the digits in your score. What is the value of the digit 4 in your score of 1489?”

hi.html:
"Toh," Nikki ne kaha, "ek staan ka ank aapko bataata hai ki us staan ka mooly kya hai. udaaharan ke lie, saikadon staan ka ank aapko bataata hai ki kitne saikadon hain. Yadi, agar saikadon staan mein ank 1 hai, toh 100 ka moolya hai. Yadi waha ank 3 hai, to 300 ka moolya hai. "

"Ab, tum koshish karo!" Nikki ne kaha. "Aapka score 1489 mai ank 4 ka moolya kya hai?"

Hum Jay ki score ko dekhte hain. Daen she shuru karte hue,

  • Ank 9 ek yani "ones" staan par hai. Ones staan ka moolya 1 hai. Toh "9 ek"=9.
  • Ank 8 das yani "tens" staan par hai. Tens staan ka moolya 10 hai. Toh "8 dasiyon"=80.
  • Ank 1 hajaaron yani "thousands" staan par hai. Thousands staan ka value 1000 hai. Toh "1 hajaaron"=1000.

Ank 4 ke baarein mein kya? Wo saikadon staan par hai. Toh, uska moolya kya hoga?

Nahi, wo sahi nahi hai. Agar sakhya 1234 hoti, phir ank 4 ka moolya bhi 4 hoti. Yeh isliye kyun ki ank 4 ek yani 'ones' staan par hai, aur har ank jo ones staan par hai, uska moolya 1 hai. Toh, "4 Ek"=4.

Par, Jay ke score main, 4 saikadon staan par hain. Saikadon staan pe har ank ki moolya 100 hai. Toh, 4 ka moolya kya hoga?

Nahi, wo sahi nahi hai. Agar sakhya 1243 hoti, phir ank 4 ka moolya 40 hoti. Yeh isliye kyun ki ank 4 dasiyon yani 'tena' staan par hai, aur har ank jo tens staan par hai, uska moolya 10 hai. Toh, "4 Dasiyon"=40.

Par, Jay ke score main, 4 saikadon staan par hain. Saikadon staan pe har ank ki moolya 100 hai. Toh, 4 ka moolya kya hoga?
Sahi hai!
4 saikadon staan par hai. Saikadon staan ka moolya kya hai?

Nahi, wo sahi nahi hai. Agar sakhya 4231 hoti, phir ank 4 ka moolya 4000 hoti. Yeh isliye kyun ki ank 4 hajaaron yani 'thousands' staan par hai, aur har ank jo thousands staan par hai, uska moolya 1000 hai. Toh, "4 Hajaaron"=4000.

Par, Jay ke score main, 4 saikadon staan par hain. Saikadon staan pe har ank ki moolya 100 hai. Toh, 4 ka moolya kya hoga?
Iss sankhya mein, ank 4 ka moolya "4 saikadon" hai. Agar har saikadon ka moolya 100 hai, toh 4 saikadon ka moolya kya hoga?
Nahi, wo sahi nahi hai. 4 saikadon staan par hai. Saikadon staan ka moolya kya hai? Yeh moolya aapko madad karega pata lagane ke liye ki 4 ki kya moolya hai.

content.html:
Well done! Now, you and Jaime know the value of each place, and how to add up these values to make a number. With your help, Jaime also now knows enough to figure out how much his score is worth. Now, he’s closer to being able to read his score!

Also, Jaime made sure to remember some important things he learned. You might want to write them down, so you remember them, too!

  • Each place has a different value, depending on its location.

  • The digit in a place tells you how much of that place value is in the number.

  • Here are the names of all the places and their values:

hi.html:
Bahut badhiya! Ab, aapako aur Jay ko har ek sthaan ka moolya pata hai, aur sankhya banaane ke liye in moolyon ko kaise jodana hai, wo bhi pata hain. Aapaki madad se, Jay pata laga sakta hai ki uska score kitna bada hai.

Saath hee, Jay ne kuch jaroore baaton ko yaad karli. Aap bhi unhen likh sakte ho, taaki aapko bhi yaad rahen!

  • Har ek sthaan ka ek alag mooly hota hai.
  • Kisi sthaan ka ank aapako bataata hai ki sankhya mein us sthaan ka mooly kitana hai.
  • Yahaan sabhi sthaanon ke naam aur unke mooly diye gaye hain:

feedback.html: Correct!

No, that's not correct. 1 is the value associated with the "ones" place, but the digit in the ones place is 9. This means that the 9 means "9 ones". How much is that? 

Try again!

No, that's not correct. If you get stuck, take a look at how you did the previous questions. You can solve this one in a similar way.

Try again!

hint_content.html: The digit 9 is in the ones place. What is the value for each of the "ones"?

Look at where the 9 is in the number 1489, and "ignore" the other digits by changing them to zeros. That will give you the value of 9 in the number 1489.

Also, remember that you can ignore zeros that come at the beginning of the number. But you can't ignore zeros at the end. (So, "005" is the same as "5", but "1200" is not the same as "12".)

content.html: “How about the digit 9? What is the value of the digit 9 in your score?” Nic asked.

hi.html: "Aapka score 1489 mai ank 9 ka moolya kya hai?" Nikki ne pucha.
Nahi, wo sahi nahi hai. Ek staan ka moolya ek hai. Lekin, ek staan pe ank 9 hai. Toh, iska moolya "9 ek" hai. Wo kitna hai? Phir se koshish karo.
Sahi hai!
Ank 9 Ek yani ones staan par hain. Ek staan ka moolya kya hai?

Nahi, wo sahi nahi hai. Agar aap bhool gaye ho, toh vaapis jaake dekho ki aapne dusre savaalon ke jawaab kaise diye. Yeh wala savaal unke jaise hi hain. Phir se koshish karo!

feedback.html: Correct!

No, that's not correct. The 1 in 1489 represents "thousands", but your answer has a 1 in the "ones" place.

When calculating the digit value of 1 in 1489, you can replace the other digits with zeros. But, don't delete them, since that will change the value of the remaining digits.

Try again!

No, that's not correct. Look at where the 1 is in the number 1489, and "ignore" the other digits by changing them to zeros. That will give you the value of the digit 1 in 1489.

content.html: “What about another digit in your score: 1489? What is the value of the digit 1 in your score?” Nic asked.

hi.html: "Aapka score 1489 mai ank 1 ka moolya kya hai?" Nikki ne pucha.
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Sankhya 1489 main, ank 1 hajaaron yani thousands staan par hai. Jab hum moolya pata laga rahe hain, toh hum dusre staanon ke ank 0 se badal sakte hain. Phir se try karo!
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Sankhya 1489 main, ank 1 hajaaron yani thousands staan par hai. Jab hum moolya pata laga rahe hain, toh hum dusre staanon ke ank 0 se badal sakte hain. Phir se try karo!

Ank 1 hajaaron yani thousands staan par hai. Uska moolya kya hoga?

feedback.html: Correct! Well done. That was a hard one!

No, that's not correct. The question says "9 ones", but your answer only has 1 ones.

Make sure to put each digit in the right place. Try again!

No, that's not correct. If your number has zeroes in the middle, don't remove them, because that will change the value of the number.

Try again. You can do this!

No, that's not correct. Make sure to put each digit in the correct place. In this question, the places are not given in order, so you need to be extra careful.

Let's try again!

hint_content.html:
The place values in Nic's question are out of order. But you can still build up the number, one digit at a time!

For example, "1 hundreds" can be written as:

            __ 1 __ __

since the hundreds place is the 3rd place from the right. (You might need to add more blanks to the left later. That's OK. Just make sure the digit 1 stays in the 3rd place from the right.)

See if you can finish the rest of the question!

content.html:
“Well done!” said Nic. "Just one more!”

"Make it a hard one!" said Jaime.

"Okay!" said Nic. "What is the value of 7 thousands + 9 ones + 1 hundred?"

hi.html:
"Bahut badiya!", Nikki ne kaha. "Ab, aakhri savaal."

"Ek kathin savaal dedo!" Jay ne kaha.

"Theek hain." Nikki ne kaha. "7 hajaaron+9 ek+ek saikadon" kaunsi sankhya hai?
Nahi, ye sahi nahi hai. Aapke sankhya main, 1 ek staan par hai. Lekin savaal mein, 9 ek staan par honi chahiye.
Agar ek staan ke value nahi hai, iska matlab hai ki uss staan pe ank 0 aayega. Phir se koshish karo!
Sahi hai! Bahot badiya! Aap acche se samajh gaye!

Pehle, sankhya ke ankon ke liye kuchh liney likhdo. 4 sthaan maan hain, isliye 4 liney honge:

 __ __ __ __

Ab, pehli pankti se shuru karte hain. saikadon staan ka moolya 100 hai. dhyaan do ki 1 daeen or se 3 vi sthaan par hai. Toh, daeen or se 3 vi sthaan par 1 likho:

__ 1 __ __

Ab aap yeh karte rahe saari pankti ke liye!
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Sunishchit karo ki har ank sahi staan par hai. Dhyaan rakho, iss savaal mai, staanon sahi karum main nahi hai. Phir se koshish karo.

exploration.title: The Value of a Number
exploration.objective: Learn the value of each place, and how to find the value of each digit in a number.
